page.title: 02 EDUCATION
page.content: {KING EDWARD VI HIGH SCHOOL,}on a beautiful thirty acre site in Cottingwood Lane, provides for 1300 pupils{13-19yrs}from Morpeth,Rothbury and the surrounding countryside, and also for Adult and Youth Associations. {NEWMINSTER MIDDLE SCHOOL's}pupils come from the town and Kirkhill estate.{ {CHANTRY MIDDLE SCHOOL}serves Lancaster Park and Stobhill housing estates and the surrounding villages and farms. Both schools, standing side by side in spacious grounds in Mitford Road, have about 500 pupils aged{9-13yrs.} { WANSBECK St.AIDAN C.E.FIRST SCHOOL} takes{5-9 years old}from Lancaster Park, Bullers Green and the area round Mitford, plus any Morpeth children requiring a C.E. education. {St.ROBERT of NEWMINSTER R.C. FIRST {SCHOOL,}Oldgate, serves the R.C. families of the whole area.
